paragraphs: Dunedin, or Ōtepoti in Māori, was originally inhabited by the Māori people of the Ngāi Tahu iwi. Its harbour and surrounding lands were valued for food gathering and transport.
Founded in 1848 by Scottish settlers, Dunedin quickly grew during the Otago Gold Rush of the 1860s. It became one of New Zealand’s richest and most important cities in the 19th century.
Today, Dunedin is renowned for its well-preserved Victorian and Edwardian architecture, strong Scottish heritage, and its vibrant university culture, centered around the University of Otago.
